award_title: IUCRC Phase I University of Wisconsin-Madison: Center for Interdisciplinary Research on Convective Storms (CIRCS)
subject: Bridging convective storm models to reusable tools?
body:
Hi Daniel,

Reading about CIRCS, I found myself thinking about how much computational infrastructure sits behind work like this—ensemble forecasting, AI-based risk assessment, high-resolution weather prediction. These methods often get described in papers but rarely become something others can directly call and build on.

I'm working on Ouro, a place where published computational methods become callable, reusable infrastructure—so others can build on your work without reimplementing it from scratch.

Given the industry-facing nature of CIRCS, I'm curious whether making your modeling tools more accessible to partners is something you've thought about.

If you're curious, I can show you how it works.

Hope winter break treats you well—happy holidays!

Best,

Matt Moderwell
https://ouro.foundation
